email.title: Weekly Digest
email.text:
Hi everyone!
Hope you've had a great week!
In this digest you'll find info about a Virtual Games Social organised by Women in Computing, an update from The Equality, Diversity and Culture Committee and opportunities from our sponsors.
email.heading: Women in Computing - Virtual Games Social
email.text:
![WiC Poster](https://i.imgur.com/I7FD8Lw.png)
Join WiC for a **Virtual Games Social** to celebrate International Day of Women and Girls in Science! Meet new people and socialise over board games with a host of Women in STEM groups across UK universities.
Running over two days: on [**WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 10, 2021 AT 7 PM UTC**](https://www.facebook.com/events/340736066998711) and on [**SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 13, 2021 AT 1 PM UTC**](https://www.facebook.com/events/854793095366333)
If you'd like to attend, [**sign up here**](https://forms.gle/4NVdoUij6jHPNivG7). All genders welcome!
In collaboration with ICL WiM, ICL WiP, ICL WiEE, ICL WSET, Cambridge WiS, Cambridge WiC, Cambridge WiP, KCL WiS, Warwick WES, Durham WiS, Edinburgh Hoppers, Manchester WiSE
email.heading: The Equality, Diversity and Culture Committee
email.text:
Do you want to help encourage diversity and equality in Computing and represent your view? The Equality, Diversity and Culture Committee (EDCC) strive to continually maintain and improve equality and diversity amongst staff and students. Their current objectives are:
No staff or student should be disadvantaged because of their gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability or any other protected characteristics (Equality Act 2010).
* The Department should provide an inclusive environment for all staff and students.
* The Department should strive for diversity of staff and students along all dimensions.
* The EDCC welcomes anyone to come and attend their bi-termly meeting to discuss such matters - all discussions are open!
If you feel you have experienced something you would like to discuss however do not feel comfortable attending the meeting please do one or all of the following:
* Talk to your year reps as they can discuss the issue for you.
* Submit anonymous feedback by form here: https://edcc.doc.ic.ac.uk/contact/
* Email anonymously to doc-equality@imperial.ac.uk - the exchange will be kept private

email.heading: Bank of America Quantitative Management Analyst Programme (QMAP)
email.sponsor:
The programme consists of two one-year rotations in quantitative disciplines along with customized training and continuing education. Upon completion of the program, QMAP graduates have a broad range of global career opportunities within the bank.
As an analyst within Quantitative Management based in London, you will:
* Join a 2 year rotational programme focusing on capital markets, instrument pricing/valuation, and counterparty credit risk management
* Apply quantitative analysis to business problems
* Develop solutions for Derivatives and Exotics, Price Valuation, Model Risk Management, Risk Analytics, Automated Solutions, Counterparty Credit Risk
* Implement solutions applying both qualitative and quantitative aspects in capital markets, finance, and risk management
* Use modelling techniques to quantify and determine solutions to business problems
* Gain real, in-depth experience applying quantitative knowledge to specific financial challenges
Apply [here](https://bankcampuscareers.tal.net/vx/brand-0/candidate/so/pm/1/pl/1/opp/6182-EMEA-London-Global-Quantitative-Management-Program-Full-Time-Analyst-Programme/en-GB)
Application Closing Date: 26th March 2021
email.heading: Palantir Scholarship and Event Opportunities!
email.sponsor:
[Palantir Scholarship](https://www.palantir.com/students/scholarship/) and [Event Opportunities](http://www.palantir.events/palantirevents-spring2021)!
At Palantir, we strongly believe that true innovation stagnates in the absence of representation, and it's our mission to contribute to meaningful growth and change within the technology sector. As a part of this mission we launched our Scholarship programs to provide opportunities for future leaders in tech to thrive and impact the world through their work.
The 2021 application period is now open and we are accepting applications. We strongly encourage you to apply!
### [Women in Technology Scholarship](https://www.palantir.com/students/scholarship/wit-europe/)
### [Global Impact Scholarship](https://www.palantir.com/students/scholarship/global-impact/)
Lastly, we invite you to learn more about life at Palantir, straight from our internal affinity group communities. We will host an information session and product demo in February, and discussions on topics of identity in March. We will share event dates and details in the coming weeks - [sign up here](http://www.palantir.events/palantirevents-spring2021) if you'd like to be included in the event updates!
For any questions, please view our [website](https://www.palantir.com/students/) for more details and contact information. You can also find our current openings for interns and new graduates listed on our [careers page](https://www.palantir.com/careers/).
